title: WWII Vets Never Compensated After Race-Based Mustard Gas Experiments
teaser: An investigation by NPR has found that minority soldiers were singled out, and that the VA failed to keep its promise to pay benefits.
contentencoded:
This week, NPR uncovered race-based mustard gas experiments on American troops during World War II, and that the Department of Veterans Affairs failed to compensate veterans permanently injured by the tests.

NPRâ€™s Caitlin Dickerson spent the last eight months reporting for this investigation and joins Here & Now’s Robin Young to talk about the veterans she interviewed and how Congress is responding to their stories.

Guest
